Trump Threatens to Permanently Pull Funding From W.H.O.President Trump also said in a letter that he might revoke U.S. membership in the World Health Organization if the group did not make changes.It’s a significant escalation of efforts to deflect blame over the United States government’s halting response to the virus.
A feud between the U.S. and China over the coronavirus erupted at a W.H.O. meeting.

Economy
Asian markets follow Wall Street’s surge, but doubts linger.
Stocks have their biggest gain in weeks as Wall Street is encouraged by a vaccine prospect.
Pandemic forces 7-Eleven to let stores in Japan reduce hours.
Poor countries borrowed billions from China, but can’t pay it back.
Global
China and Germany push for international cooperation, as the U.S. puts America first.
After a devastating outbreak in Ecuador, the authorities struggle to identify the dead.
The people of Wuhan are slowly getting back to normal.
Germany’s far right is driving protests against the country’s coronavirus restrictions.

Trump Says He’s Taking Hydroxychloroquine, Prompting CriticismDespite warnings about the malaria drug and a lack of evidence that it can prevent Covid-19, President Trump said he had been taking it for over a week.
Small Vaccine Trial Shows Promise; Stocks SoarThe drugmaker Moderna said a test in eight healthy volunteers found its experimental vaccine was safe and provoked a strong immune response.

Trump to Tap New Company to Make Covid-19 Drugs in the U.S.The Trump administration will announce one of the largest-ever contracts to bring pharmaceutical manufacturing from abroad to a new plant in Virginia.

Investigator Fired by Trump Had Examined Weapons Sales to SaudisA Democratic House committee chairman said the inquiry might have been “another reason” that President Trump fired the State Department inspector general.
Jailed Saudis Seek Influence in WashingtonHoping for release, some are hiring lobbyists with links to the Trump administration — at a challenging moment for the crown prince.
Hilary Swift for The New York Times
These N.Y.C. Neighborhoods Have the Highest Rates of Virus DeathsRace and income are the key factors that decide who dies from Covid-19 and who survives, city data shows.
Fear of Risk Could Diminish Treasury and Fed Rescue EffortThe Treasury does not want to lose taxpayer money on central bank emergency lending. That could leave riskier companies out in the cold.

Anti-Vaxxers, Anticapitalists and Neo-Nazis Join German ProtestsThe pandemic marginalized the far right, as Germans rallied behind Chancellor Angela Merkel. But the reopening has brought them back.
Chancellor Angela Merkel backed the idea of shared European debt for a virus recovery fund.
